CardPickup

Class HandEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardPickup.HandEvaluator

  • public class HandEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
    The HandEvaluator is a class that is used to rank hands numerically. For PokerApp, the hand ranking system goes as follows: Royal Straight Flush = 150.0f Five of a kind = 135.0f - 149.99999f Straight flush = 120.0f - 134.99999f Four of a kind = 105.0f - 119.99999f Full House = 90.0f - 104.99999f Flush = 75.0f - 89.99999f Straight = 60.0f - 74.99999f Three of a kind = 45.0f - 59.99999f Two Pair = 30.0f - 44.99999f Pair = 15.0f - 29.99999f High Card = 0.0f - 14.99999f The higher the number is in the range, the better of that type of hand it is. The decimal places make up the kicker(s).

    • Method Detail

      • rankHand

        public float rankHand(Hand h)
        rankHand() is used to return the rank of a hand. This version will take a Hand argument and use up to 5 cards in the hand to rank. It will start with the hole cards, and then the up cards and finally the shared cards. It will only take up to 5 cards - if there are more, they get ignored.
        Parameters:
        h - The hand to rank
        Returns:
        The numerical rank of the Hand

      • rankHand

        public float rankHand(Card c1)
        rankHand() is used to return the rank of a hand. This version will take a single Card and return its rank
        Parameters:
        c1 - The Card to rank
        Returns:
        The numerical rank of the Card

      • isFlush

        public boolean isFlush(Card c1,
              Card c2,
              Card c3)
        isFlush() is used to determine if the hand is (or can be) a flush. This version takes three Cards as arguments and returns true if all are the same suit.
        Parameters:
        c1 - The first Card
        c2 - The second Card
        c3 - The third Card
        Returns:
        True if this hand is all the same suit. False otherwise.

      • isStraight

        public float isStraight(Card c1,
               Card c2)
        isStraight() is used to determine if the hand is (or can be) a straight. This version takes two Cards as arguments and determines if they can be used as part of a straight.
        Parameters:
        c1 - The first Card
        c2 - The second Card
        Returns:
        The value of the highest possible straight the cards can make. -1.0f if a straight cannot be made.
